title: How to Make Wrist Candy

steps.headline: Gather your supplies.
steps.description: See the list at the bottom of the page, under "Things You'll Need".

steps.headline: Cut the cord.
steps.description:
Measure and cut two pieces of the waxed linen cord into 25 inch (63.5cm) and 18” (46cm) strands. Fold the 25 inch strand in half, and match one end of the 18” strand with both ends of the 25” strand. Fold the rest of the 18” strand over the folded part of the 25” strand creating two loops. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/5d\/Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/5d\/Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-2.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":505.27472527472526,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Make a knot.
steps.description:
Tie a basic overhand knot about a half-inch (1.5cm) down, leaving enough space for the toggle closure to fit through the loops. This will leave you will 4 strands. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/0e\/Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/0e\/Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":505.27472527472526,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Cut the fourth and shortest strand completely off.
steps.description:
You should now have 3 equal strands left for braiding. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/94\/Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-4.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-4.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/94\/Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-4.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":505.27472527472526,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Begin to braid your bracelet.
steps.description:
Continue the braid about an inch (2.5cm) down from the loop. Make sure you keep the braid tight, to prevent unraveling later. If you do not know how to braid, see How to braid or How to braid a bracelet and teach yourself. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/81\/Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-5.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/81\/Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-5.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":505.27472527472526,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Braid in the beads.
Continue threading the beads.
Finish the bracelet.
Thread the remaining strand through the toggle closure.
Repeat these steps until you have several bracelets made.
steps.description: Layer them on with a statement piece of jewelry (something more expensive to jazz the look up). Use different color cording and beads to make the look even more fun and interesting. You’ve now created "wrist candy" on a budget!

text:
Gather your supplies. See the list at the bottom of the page, under "Things You'll Need". Cut the cord. Measure and cut two pieces of the waxed linen cord into 25 inch (63.5cm) and 18” (46cm) strands. Fold the 25 inch strand in half, and match one end of the 18” strand with both ends of the 25” strand. Fold the rest of the 18” strand over the folded part of the 25” strand creating two loops. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5d/Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5d/Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":505.27472527472526,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Make a knot. Tie a basic overhand knot about a half-inch (1.5cm) down, leaving enough space for the toggle closure to fit through the loops. This will leave you will 4 strands. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0e/Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-3.jpg/v4-460px-Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0e/Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-3.jpg/v4-760px-Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":505.27472527472526,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Cut the fourth and shortest strand completely off. You should now have 3 equal strands left for braiding. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/94/Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-4.jpg/v4-460px-Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-4.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/94/Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-4.jpg/v4-760px-Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":505.27472527472526,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Begin to braid your bracelet. Continue the braid about an inch (2.5cm) down from the loop. Make sure you keep the braid tight, to prevent unraveling later. If you do not know how to braid, see How to braid or How to braid a bracelet and teach yourself. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/81/Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-5.jpg/v4-460px-Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/81/Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-5.jpg/v4-760px-Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":505.27472527472526,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Braid in the beads. Thread a bead onto the outer left strand. Thread the bead and push against the base of the braid. Then cross the left strand over the middle. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/de/Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-7.jpg/v4-460px-Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-7.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/de/Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-7.jpg/v4-760px-Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-7.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":505.27472527472526,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Do the same but with the right strand this time. Thread the bead onto the outer right strand, push against the base of the braid, and cross over the middle. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/ce/Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-8.jpg/v4-460px-Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-8.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/ce/Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-8.jpg/v4-760px-Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-8.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":505.27472527472526,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Continue threading the beads. Rotate between the outer right and outer left strands. Thread the beads before crossing the strands over the middle. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/17/Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-9.jpg/v4-460px-Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-9.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/17/Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-9.jpg/v4-760px-Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-9.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":505.27472527472526,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Complete braiding the beads in. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f0/Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-10.jpg/v4-460px-Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-10.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f0/Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-10.jpg/v4-760px-Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-10.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":505.27472527472526,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Finish the bracelet. Leave a tail of about another inch (2.5cm) or so of braided cord. Measure against the wrist to ensure the bracelet isn’t too small or too big, then secure with an overhand knot. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f7/Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-12.jpg/v4-460px-Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-12.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f7/Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-12.jpg/v4-760px-Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-12.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":505.27472527472526,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Trim the two shortest strands completely off. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c2/Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-13.jpg/v4-460px-Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-13.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c2/Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-13.jpg/v4-760px-Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-13.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":505.27472527472526,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Thread the remaining strand through the toggle closure. Butt it up against the braided section, then secure with another overhand knot. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/31/Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-15.jpg/v4-460px-Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-15.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/31/Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-15.jpg/v4-760px-Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-15.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":505.27472527472526,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Trim any excess cording. Be careful not to cut the knot. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/23/Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-16.jpg/v4-460px-Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-16.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/23/Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-16.jpg/v4-760px-Make-DIY-Wrist-Candy-Step-16.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":505.27472527472526,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Repeat these steps until you have several bracelets made. Layer them on with a statement piece of jewelry (something more expensive to jazz the look up). Use different color cording and beads to make the look even more fun and interesting. You’ve now created "wrist candy" on a budget!
